categories.summary:
# Analysis of ðŸ’¬ï½œgeneral Discord Channel

## 1. Summary:
The chat primarily revolves around ElizaOS development and usage issues. Key technical discussions include model configuration for Anthropic API, Windows compatibility issues with ElizaOS, and questions about the new v2 architecture where plugins are separated. Users encountered problems with conversation history disappearing after inactivity and changing default model settings. There was clarification that environment variables can be modified to change the AI model being used, specifically setting `SMALL_ANTHROPIC_MODEL=claude-3-5-sonnet-20241022` in the .env file to switch from Haiku to Sonnet. The conversation also touched on broken documentation links and questions about differences between v1.0.0-beta and v2.

## 2. FAQ:
Q: Does ElizaOS use the index.ts file after using elizaos create? (asked by WizardlyLuke) A: Try using "elizaos start" instead of npm commands (answered by sayonara)
Q: How does ElizaOS determine which LLM it's using when multiple keys are set up? (asked by WizardlyLuke) A: Unanswered
Q: Why does my conversation with AI agent disappear after a few minutes? (asked by Ocisly) A: Unanswered
Q: How can I make the agent use the Sonnet model instead of Haiku? (asked by Buttered) A: Change `SMALL_ANTHROPIC_MODEL=claude-3-5-sonnet-20241022` in your .env file (answered by sayonara)
Q: Is v2 different than the 1.0.0-beta? (asked by WizardlyLuke) A: Unanswered
Q: What version should I be using? (asked by WizardlyLuke) A: Unanswered
Q: Are there any good open source projects building on Eliza's v2? (asked by lantianlaoli) A: Unanswered
Q: Is it possible to dynamically load new characters with plugins while the runtime is running? (asked by DorianD) A: If plugins are already installed it should work, but might cause issues if not installed (answered by shaw)

## 3. Help Interactions:
Helper: sayonara | Helpee: WizardlyLuke | Context: ElizaOS not using updated index.ts file on Windows | Resolution: Suggested using "elizaos start" command and confirmed it works in WSL
Helper: sayonara | Helpee: Buttered | Context: Difficulty making agent use Sonnet model instead of Haiku | Resolution: Provided specific environment variable to change in .env file with reference to GitHub code
Helper: shaw | Helpee: DorianD | Context: Question about dynamically loading characters with plugins | Resolution: Suggested it should work if plugins are already installed but might cause issues otherwise

## 4. Action Items:
Technical: Fix broken documentation links on eliza.how website | Description: Links like https://eliza.how/blog/v1-v2 are not working | Mentioned By: WizardlyLuke
Technical: Fix conversation history disappearing after 3-5 minutes of inactivity | Description: In version 0.25.9, chat history disappears after brief periods of inactivity | Mentioned By: Ocisly
Technical: Improve Windows compatibility | Description: ElizaOS has issues with code changes not being reflected when running on Windows | Mentioned By: WizardlyLuke
Documentation: Create clear documentation about model selection and environment variables | Description: Users are confused about how to change models and what env variables control this | Mentioned By: Buttered
Documentation: Clarify differences between v1.0.0-beta and v2 | Description: Users are confused about version differences and which to use | Mentioned By: WizardlyLuke

The chat segment is extremely brief, containing only a single interaction. YungYoda advises another user that they need to use Ubuntu WSL2 for Windows to run a program called "eliza" properly. This suggests there may have been a prior discussion about compatibility issues with running eliza on Windows natively, and YungYoda is providing a solution by recommending the Windows Subsystem for Linux (WSL2) with Ubuntu as the environment where eliza runs without problems.
